title: Did the lack of social discrimination in 1918 cause more deaths than the Second World War?
subtitle: A viral idea of the Spanish flu epidemic gets some correct general points, but the timetable presented is inaccurate.
author: Dan Evon
vclaim: People began to ignore the rules of social exclusion during the 1918 epidemic, leading to a second wave of infection that killed more people than all of World War I.
